attributes.action: Scrap school league tables to reduce pressures on young people and teachers
attributes.background: At the root cause of mental health difficulties in young people are league tables. There is pressure on students and staff to succeed as they are judged on exam performance data. Students with special educational needs flounder or move from mainstream schools which are struggling to be inclusive.
attributes.additional_details:
The government recognises the need to transform the mental health provision for children and young people (Green paper, Dec 2017). Whilst the proposals are welcomed, it would make sense to address the underlying causes. 
The Guardian stated that exclusions are increasing partly because schools are under pressure to compete in league tables and exam results. Disruptive,vulnerable pupils who are likely to lower overall GCSE performance are weeded out before their national tests (Oct 2017).

attributes.action: Ban Hate Groups, Britain First & English Defence League!
attributes.background: Under the Terrorism Act 2000, the Home Secretary may proscribe(ban) an organisation if (s)he believes it is concerned in terrorism, and it is proportionate to do. We call upon the Home Secretary to add Britain First and the EDL to the list of proscribed organisations.
attributes.additional_details:
This same terrorism act declares "acts of terrorism" as "acts of persons acting on behalf of, or in connection with, any organisation which carries out activities directed towards the overthrowing or influencing, by force or violence, of Her Majesty's government in the United Kingdom or any other government de jure or de facto."
We believe Britain First are advocates of racially motivated violence and this is well documented with violence at rallies and unfettered hate speech.
Britain does not tolerate this when it is religiously motivated, why should we tolerate it when it is founded on 'Nationalism'.

attributes.action: Get compensation from the Government for the Immigration (Windrush) Victims
attributes.background: The people who have been threatened with deportation, who have lost wages and jobs and the stress of having to apply for citizenship in a country (GB) where they understood they had a right to stay. The Government has not kept the records pre-1973. That is a failure on the Government's part .
attributes.additional_details: I have lived here for 61 years, worked, paid tax, married, passed my driving test etc.  I was never questioned re my Canadian birth cert, I arrived here on my mother's Passport as she returned to England after my Fathers death in Canada 1956. My father fought in the last world war as a volunteer. I have always known I had an independent right to stay. I have now had to apply for citizenship, been stopped from working for 15 months. Loss of earnings is debilitating. I am stressed out and angry.

attributes.action: Reduce knife and gun crime with deterrent sentences
attributes.background:
10 yrs minimum for carrying a knife 
20 yrs minimum for using a knife 

20yrs minimum for carrying a gun
40yrs minimum for using a gun

All without parole.
attributes.additional_details:
The current sentences that the judiciary are handing out are obviously not deterrent enough

Act now !

Save lives !

attributes.action: Make it law that it is reported to the police when a cat is knocked down.
attributes.background: Unlike the current laws regarding dogs, it is NOT required to report the knocking down of a cat. Not only is it unfair, but also cruel. A cat has as much right as a dog, however, they are not given the same kindness and protection of the current laws of our lands.

attributes.action: Insist the Government give a 50% discount for Council Tax single occupants
attributes.background: At the moment single occupants get a 25% reduction in their Council Tax which is most unfair. In houses with more than one person there are more like to be dual or more incomes, so there the reduction should be 50% to single occupant earners or pensioners as they are pay 25% more on one income.

attributes.action: Increase the defence budget to strengthen and build up the UK's Armed Forces.
attributes.background: The UK needs to strengthen and build up it's Armed Forces in order to be able to counter any threat to the Nation and to better its capabilities as a part of NATO.

attributes.action: Mandate display of plastic:food volume ratio on all packaged foods items.
attributes.background:
More than 8 million tonnes of plastic reaches our oceans each year. 
By providing consumers with a plastic:food ratio on all packaging (with an associated red, amber or green rating) we will give them the facts to enable them to accept or reject products based on their impact on our environment.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Department of Health's colour coded front-of-pack scheme was introduced in 2009 and gives consumers the nutritional info they need to make the best choices for their health. Research into similar schemes has shown that sales of green items increased by 5% and sales of red items decreased by 9%.

Showing the ratio of plastic packaging:food volume empowers consumers to make the best choice for the health of our oceans. Let consumer power change the way global food corporations package.

attributes.action: Bring back the convalescent homes in the UK
attributes.background: The A&E departments are oversubscribed because there are insufficient beds in the hospital's due to the lack of care providers for discharged patients . This deficit in care provision is because the care sector is underpaid especially because of pay and conditions. We need convalescent homes back.
attributes.additional_details: The rural areas have a lack of home care provision brought about by low wage levels and pay conditions which deny payments for travel time and mileage. This means that the rural areas are not easily served. Hence these care providers have a high turnover of staff. For the majority of single elderly, a return home after major surgery is one with no care. Convalescent homes would allow a low level of staffing serving more patients.  Benefits to patients is safety, peer competition & high morale.

attributes.action: Ban over taking on the A35 one of Dorset’s most dangerous roads!
attributes.background: The a35 Dorset between Poole and Bere Regis is fast becoming one of Dorset’s deadliest roads. We have seen many deaths and road closures over the last few years and now it’s time to keep the road users safe. Make this road a no over taking policy road and reduce the speed limit.

attributes.action: Ensure vics of CSA under UK est care get full legal redress like NSW & Victoria
attributes.background: With IICSA currently investigating the full extent of CSA in the UK, we the undersigned believe that all councils and establishments under whose care such occurs should by law provide full legal redress.
attributes.additional_details: We require Parliament to pass an Act to make it possible as is the case in NSW and Victoria, Australia for victims of child sex abuse to be permitted full legal redress automatically.

attributes.action: No to automatic opt in for organ donation
attributes.background: UK resident will be automatically opted in for organ donation and will have the choice to opt out after the Bill is passed.  This law should not be passed because it is our body and it is our human right to opt in ourselves if we want to.
attributes.additional_details: Our body is not the property of the government to give this consent on our behalf. It is a  violation of our human rights. People are aware of organ donation and can choose to opt in if they wish to opt in. People may not be able to opt out before their death as death can be sudden. People may not be aware of this law so it will be unethical to opt them in as they wouldn't know they have to opt out. We refuse this law should be passed where peoole are automatically registered to organ donation.

attributes.action: Call upon the British Government to stop Northern Ireland MLAs pay.
attributes.background: Northern Ireland MLAs are still being paid after yet again no agreement. People that are not doing work should not be paid and we all know it will encourage a deal to be made.

attributes.action: Reinstate AS levels for sixth form students (aged 16-18) in the UK
attributes.background: As of 2015, the AS level (examined in Year 1 &2)  has been removed in place of a ‘linear Alevel’ structure (examined Y2)  - How are students expected to retain all 2 years worth of content whilst completing UCAS, working, doing extra curricular activities and maintaining their mental health ?
attributes.additional_details: https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/www.tes.com/news/school-news/breaking-news/pupils-exam-stress-rising-dramatically-new-figures-show%3famp

attributes.action: Freedom of Information Act should apply to any company working for the Govt.
attributes.background: There are many Private sector companies that have accepted a contract from either Local or Central Government. They are receiving tax payers money, yet are providing no transparency to the public. Its time for these companies to be included in the the current FOI.

attributes.action: Scrap the points on speeding offences
attributes.background:
Government should scrap the points for speeding offences only keep fines if any one is speeding they should get fine no points 
This government should scrap the points on speeding offences

attributes.action: Include teaching on online safety to children in all Primary & Secondary schools
attributes.background: Children and young people are increasingly vulnerable to online bullying, abuse and exploitation, as well as serious crime networks.This needs to be acknowledged in schools, and children need to be empowered to better protect themselves and their peers from online abuse.

attributes.action: Stop Reducing our Armed Forces and Spend 3% of GDP. CUT AID to 0.3% to fund it.
attributes.background: When I say "reduce" I mean in three ways: Funding, manpower & resources and credibility. We're told the Government spends 2% of GDP on defence and we have "the second largest budget in NATO... Largest in Europe". Then why can't we even match the French in capability anymore? Spend 3% GDP on Defence.
attributes.additional_details: France has 23 Destroyers and Frigates. We've 19. They've 3 Amphibious ships. We've 2 which are now going to be scrapped. Their Army is 30,000 bigger. You now want to cut another 14,000 and are talking about merging two extremely distinct units: Royal Marines and Parachute Regiment. It's a joke. You don't want the Army to "Be the Best" and the new adverts are laughable. Recruits join for war fighting, adventure and service. Not for PC. That 2% clearly feels like 1% and those in charge are inept.

attributes.action: Protect workers while in their Probationary period within an employment contract
attributes.background:
Currently the employment law does not protect employees during the probationary period of a new contract. 
An employer can dismiss the member of staff without reason within this period with no review and the employee has no legal right to challenge it. 
I feel this needs to change.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government needs to protect employees by making sure that a review meeting, through the period should be carried out allowing time to improve. 
Also if at the end of the probationary period the employer feels the employee is not suitable then a reason must be given following guidelines. 
The government should make it illegal to dismiss anyone without given support to improve or a reason why they are being dismissed. 
This is currently allowed to happen giving workers no protection

attributes.action: Release the 2012 NHS reform risk Assessment.
attributes.background: In 2012, the Health Secretary vetoed the publication of the risk assessment relating to the changes introduced in the Health and Social Care Act. The Information Commissioner's office declared that in the circumstances this was unreasonable and requested they be released.
attributes.additional_details: This petition requests that said document is released in the name of transparency.  No law was implemented to allow the government to pursue its current restructuring of the NHS and a reorganisation was guaranteed to be "off the cards" by the prime minister.  The current government has no mandate to reorganise the NHS and create ACOs.  We request access to the risk assessment in order to see if this was predicted prior to the 2012 HaSCA and whether the current collapse of the NHS was preventable

attributes.action: Government facilitate a cross party group of MP’s to assess the needs of the NHS
attributes.background: Suggest political parties stop using the problems the NHS faces for political gain and to work together to improve it for patients and employees of the service. To co-operate with each other to find the best solutions to maintaining a sustainable high level of health care for everyone.
attributes.additional_details:
The group could analyse other successful health care schemes, their procedures, expenditure measured against results. Do hospital and GP procedures need to change?

Is the British health care system working so well that it only needs more funds? If so, how can further funds be raised without increasing the national debt? All of these questions will be more credible to all political parties if answered by a cross party group of MP’s.

attributes.action: Make the 26-30 railcard pilot available to more than just Greater Anglia users.
attributes.background: As a welcome resource for travelling millennials, the 26-30 railcard was announced in the Chancellor's budget on the 22 November 2017. However, it is currently ONLY being piloted in the Greater Anglia area of the United Kingdom. I urge the government to consider piloting this in more than one area.
attributes.additional_details: Currently, millennials are one of the demographic groups in the UK that are hardest hit in terms of affordability of living. With stagnant wages and rising inflation and for most, a thirst for wanderlust, the 26-30 railcard should've been available as soon as it was announced. Another pressure on millennials is that many commute to their workplaces as majority live with their parents as they are unable to afford a house of their own. I urge the government to pilot this railcard in other areas.

attributes.action: On four lane motorways, restrict HGV vehicles and coaches to lanes 1 and 2.
attributes.background: The country has spent billions in upgrading traditional motorways to four lane smart motorways, however all this investment is wasted as soon as you get three trucks trying to overtake each other at 55mph. Trucks should be limited to lanes 1 and 2 to allow faster travellers to go in lanes 3 and 4.

attributes.action: Allow Petitions Calling for No Confidence in Ministers on petition.parliament.uk
attributes.background: Call government/parliament to allow petitions calling for a vote of No Confidence in Ministers/MPs due to the recent decision by the petitions committee not to accept/allow them. The decision should be made by the British public who politicians, parliament & the petitions committee are answerable to
attributes.additional_details: We live in a democratic country where the general public must have a voice that can be heard and taken into account.  Ministers and MPs must be accountable to the general public who should have the right to submit a petition for debate which people across the U.K. can support.  Some previous petitions calling for No Confidence have had over 100,000 signatures however only a few people in the petitions committee have decided not to allow them in the future

attributes.action: Cap train fares to coincide with the National Minimal Wage
attributes.background: Train fares have recently gone up by 1/3. This increase has resulted in the majority of hard working Britain's finding that they are paying more for their train journey then what they are being paid an hour.
attributes.additional_details: For example an individual over the age of 18 will pay £7.90 for a 22 minute train ride to work where they will be paid £5.60 for an hours of hard work. This results in a loss of over £2! This increase is barbaric and train fares should be capped in line with the National Minimal Wage to ensure everyone is able to access transport to work!

attributes.action: Ensure HMI inspectors inspecting SEN schools have sufficient experience in SEN
attributes.background: From both personal experience and talks with others educational professionals, the majority of OFSTED inspectors who grade special schools have insufficient knowledge of SEN or more shockingly, none.

attributes.action: Put additional stamp duty on international buyers
attributes.background: Foreign buyers have driven the demands of our properties. This is making properties prices higher and higher. This needs to be controlled. A lots of properties that foreign buyers own remain empty as well.

attributes.action: Lower Import duty on classic car parts from the USA.
attributes.background: Many small car/garage businesses in the UK rely on classic car parts and associated services from the USA but many struggle financially  due to the amount of duty paid. We ask Parliament to either abolish it on classic car parts or lower it to a reasonable level, with clear rules on its application
attributes.additional_details: There have been numberous instances where we have sent car parts for engineering work in the USA having already imported it from the USA only to be charged import duty again on the parts return to the UK. The rules are evidently either unfair or unclear to those applying them. Your urgent attention to this matter would be greatly appreciated.

attributes.action: Allow citizens to raise concerns about M.P.s' behaviour during Commons' Debates
attributes.background: M.P.s may raise a Point of Order during a House of Commons’ sitting if they think that an M.P. has said something offensive or inappropriate during a Commons' Debate.  There is no way for members of the public to do this.
attributes.additional_details: Members of the public should be able to raise a matter of concern with the Speaker, who should be required to report it to the House (as was tradition, such as in the case of the Imprisonment for Default of Mr. S. Saklatvala, M.P., in May 1926).

attributes.action: Referendum on whether to scrap the TV license
attributes.background:
A choice to remove the BBC's outdated and unfair, politically biased,  monopoly, by scrapping its license fee.

This decision should be put to the country in a Referendum with the question "Do you want to keep paying for the BBC License? Yes or No"

attributes.action: Make food manufacturers include the potassium content and Phosphate on labels.
attributes.background: People with Heart/Renal problems need to be mindful of the food they are eating making sure they do not consume to much potassium and phosphate, however this information is largely unknown by the manufacture. This petition aims to make the food manufacturers make this information readily available.

attributes.action: Stop all animal testing in the UK
attributes.background: Animals are dying from animal testing and it isn’t fair on them as they have lives that they should be able to live

attributes.action: Give students in unaffordable cities larger student loans for unaffordable rent.
attributes.background: Winchester, outside of London is the second most expensive place to live in the UK. House prices have increased by 59% since 2007 but student loans have been cut. Large numbers of students here spent their entire student loans on housing alone and it’s getting more and more unaffordable every year.
attributes.additional_details:
Minimum halls costs are £121 p/w to £146 p/w. 
Private housing costs roughly the same. 
There is a shortage of jobs for students who need to work to afford rent, food and necessities. A number of students work outside of Winchester to secure work. Other students choose to live in surrounding towns and cities for cheaper rent. 

https://www.independent.co.uk/life-style/uk-least-affordable-cities-house-prices-london-oxford-a7606326.html

https://www.winchester.ac.uk/accommodation-and-winchester-life/accommodation/costs/ 

https://www.your-move.co.uk/estate-agent/winchester/find-property-for-rent

attributes.action: Establish 14th March as a public holiday
attributes.background: On the passing of Stephen Hawking establish a day on which to honour him and all the nation's mathematicians and scientists (eg Newton, Halley, Babbage, Lovelace, Somerville, Berners-Lee etc etc); to fall within UK Science Week; coinciding with Pi Day. .
attributes.additional_details: A public holiday to be observed on the 14th March, a day given to discussion, deliberation, display and development of science and to encourage involvement and understanding by all

attributes.action: To implement a fishery licence to shoot a maximum of 3 otters a year.
attributes.background:
The current growth rate and lack of food for the otter has ment many well stocked fisheries to now be under attack. 
The otter while understandably protected, has outgrown its surroundings and is now ruining livelihoods of a multi billion pound industry.
attributes.additional_details:
There is so many videos of otter damage to fish, birds and wild life something has to be done to protect, 
1. Fish stocks in rivers
2. Bird life on nature reserves and rivers 
3. Fishery livelihoods. 
The continuing release of otters since 1999 has grown.
Earsham 2006 149 otters released 
And many more have been released under the radar.  
Many expensive carp have fallen victim to the otter and has cost many fisheries thousands of pounds in otter fencing where allowed and replacement of fish.

attributes.action: Toughen UK knife laws, raise the age to buy knives over 3 inches to 21 years old
attributes.background: Knife crime is an epidemic in the UK, surely raising the age to buy knives would shrink the culture our country has normalised. It would mean teenagers can no longer buy knives to use as weapons. Knife crime was 6x more likely to occur in 2017 than gun crime. I wonder why?
attributes.additional_details: London has a huge issue with knife and gang related crime, minimising the amount of people able to buy knives must surely impact this. Nearly 13000 recorded incidents of knife crime in Just London last year, with less knives on the street in the wrong hands surely this statistic would also plummet.

attributes.action: Government to fund a scheme for carers flying with a person with disabilities
attributes.background: I’m asking the government to look into possible concessions for carers who have to fly with disabled people,I understand it’s not a governmental problem it’s in it’s a commercial problem but surely there is something you can do
attributes.additional_details: These concessions are desperately needed for example  I flew to Australia in 2005 and because I’m 6’5 I’m unable to fly economy so I’m forced to fly business or first class, on this occasion I paid for first class seats but I had to provide a equal seat for my carer and the total cost for the flight was £13,000 surely you can see this is totally disgusting.  Just because I’m disabled that doesn’t mean I shouldn’t be able to go on holiday when I want

attributes.action: Repeal compulsory Relationships and Sex Education(RSE) to all UK Faith schools
attributes.background: Government plans to implement non-faith based teachings to all faith schools in the UK which is contrary to existence of faith schools

attributes.action: Reduce the deadline date of the tampon tax from 2022 to 2019!
attributes.background: The Treasury vowed to axe the outdated tax on all sanitary products in January 2016. Currently, the Tampon Tax is set to be abolished by 2022 at the earliest. Help to put an end to the marginalisation of issues of women by demanding a zero tax rate for sanitary products.
attributes.additional_details:
Women are expected to spend £900 in tax for their periods in their lifetime. Menstruation should not be labelled as a luxury.

Together, with the abolishment of the tampon tax, we can get rid of the taboo around menstruation.

attributes.action: Strip the £32m funding from Oxfam & share to the rest of the charities in the UK
attributes.background: There is 185000 Charities registered in the UK and the vast the majority rely on meagre amounts compared to this £32m to teach Oxfam a lesson who already make £90m a year from it's shops, this could significantly help the smaller independent charities up and down the entire country
attributes.additional_details: There are more than 185,000 registered charities in England and Wales. The number is rising by 5,000 a year. As you read this, another charity will be created somewhere in the country. The charity commission lists 620 cancer charities alone and more than 200 charities working with homeless people just in London. - The Guardian

attributes.action: Ban Plastic envelopes and Paper catalogues, where seller has e-mail details.
attributes.background: Having just received 5 "mail shots" in one postal delivery,from Internet retailers, they all went straight into recycling. Waste of plastic, paper, fuel and postage costs. All the Internet Retailers have my e-mail address and could just as easily have e-mailed their brochure saving all of the above.

attributes.action: Stop once and for all unsolicited SMS fraud in the UK
attributes.background: Shady companies are sending fraudulent unsolicited premium rate SMS text messages to mobile phone owners in the UK. These cost recipients up to £4.50 a message often resulting in huge bills to the victim as the fraud is likely to go unnoticed for long periods of time.
attributes.additional_details:
Find a detailed description of the issue here:

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3580058/Thousands-hit-4-50-time-scam-Customers-facing-bills-hundreds-pounds-texts-advertising-gaming-services-pornographic-content.html

This petition posits it should be a legal requirement for phone carriers to:

Not allow these services be activated on a customer’s account unless they have explicitly requested so (e.g. a representative of the carrier calls the customer to confirm activation of this service was indeed requested). If a carrier does not have this framework in place, they should not be allowed to operate premium SMS services at all.

attributes.action: Allow more people of non British Nationality/Citizenship join the British Army
attributes.background: I am not of British decent my dream would be to join the British Army as I have been living here in Scotland for 11 years and want to serve what i class as my country right now members of the Commonwealth and with British Citizenship can serve So me being Polish makes joining a real issue, Thanks.
attributes.additional_details: The last calls for Polish Citizens to be allowed to join the Forces was in 2008 but nothing came from so when i found out about this when i was doing me research I was really disappointed so i applied for a Citizenship but that also got knocked back making my dreams feel impossible to achieve so i would like peoples help in making my dreams come true and i'm sure many other people are having the same issue as me they love the country the live in but are not allowed to serve in its Armed Forces

attributes.action: Encourage greater use of driverless trains by TOCs across the UK rail network.
attributes.background: TOCs' greatest cost is the wages of train drivers. Driverless trains have existed in the UK for decades, yet only a minority of the network use them. Driverless trains would increase efficiencies, make TOCs profitable, reduce the need for government subsidy, and enable a reduction in ticket prices.
attributes.additional_details:
- Automated de/acceleration patters help energy recovery and savings, making trains more environmentally friendly
- Drivers are no longer involved in monotonous tasks of driving a train. Some can be re-qualified and deployed along the line, providing more customer service and fewer staff-less stations
- Average speed of the system can increase
- 32 cities globally use fully automated metro systems
- Ticket prices and govt subsidies are unnecessarily high due to extortionate drivers wages

attributes.action: Remove the no smoking ban from mental health hospitals
attributes.background: I recently stayed in a mental health hospital and was unable to smoke. This is almost a form of torture. For 5 days i was unable to go out or go to a smoking area. People have enough stress while in hospital, there should be a smoking area where people can go to at least once an hour

attributes.action: Require that sheltered accommodation residents are checked daily
attributes.background: A very close friend was lying unconscious while she lived in sheltered accommodation. She was not checked on which means many elderly people are being left unconscious which may then result in death.
attributes.additional_details: My friend is still in intensive care.

attributes.action: Use the money needed to change the passport colour for the NHS and the homeless
attributes.background: The Prime Minister has just announced that after Brexit our passports will change colour. This seems completely unnecessary and the money and resources needed could be put to better use like helping our underfunded NHS and helping homeless people off the streets.

attributes.action: Stop involvement in the Afghan, Syrian and Iraqi Wars and bring troops home
attributes.background: Our involvement as the UK to stop the ongoing wars is the problem.  People are unhappy that we are continuously involved in the different wars and spending too much money on the wars when we could spend it on something useful in the UK. This is a major problem and could assist other campaigns
attributes.additional_details: We are spending a net amount of at least £20.3 billion just until 2010 (combined of only the cost of the afghan and Iraqi war).Many sources state that we are spending at least 37 billion by 2017 a statement by guardian stated “By 2020, Britain will have spent at least £40bn on its Afghan campaign, enough to recruit over 5,000 police officers or nurses and pay for them throughout their careers. It could fund free tuition for all students in British higher education for 10 years."

attributes.action: Condemn the military action against ethnic Kurds by Iran and Iraq.
attributes.background: After the decision by the people of Kurdistan for independence in a referendum, retaliatory force by the Iranian backed militia and the Iraqi army against Kurdish populations in Kirkuk have resulted in dispossession and ethnically motivated crime.

attributes.action: Make ADHD part of the blue badge scheme
attributes.background: Autism and physical disabilities are included in the blue badge scheme but people don’t understand how hard it is to catch public transport and make your journey with an ADHD child!! When they have a set routine and you miss your bus ADHD is just a challenge as any other disability.
attributes.additional_details: I believe if ADHD children got accepted for a blue badge it would help a lot of families . Like less melt downs, less late trips or making shopping easier. Nothing is worse than having errands to do and your child is kicking off because you are 10 minutes late home and they have a certain routine.
